page.title: 16Leicester Canal./Glen Parva.
page.content: Part of Leics./Warks.Ring, joining Grand Union & Oxford canals for S. England circuit.{Environs:}Canal/ River Sence separates Glen Parva & Blaby for 2 km. Wharf Way ind. est.& the brickworks line northern edge of canal which is also extensively lined with houses & a stretch of parkland serving Eyres Monsell. Adjoining canal is the"County Arms" steak house and a marina for boat repairs/sales.Canal is crossed by 4 bridges including 1 railway & 1 road bridge being built. Pasture land lines southern banks. {Plants}-usual common types,Iris, Cow Parsley.{Birds/Animals-}include } Moorhens, Mallard Ducks, Water Voles {Fish-}Chub,Pike,Roach,Bream.{Leisure {use}-Leic/Wig. Angling Soc's control fishing. Season begins June 16th. Narrow boats/pleasure craft use canal. Fishing access/moorings to many houses
